job_title: Full Time Faculty in Rock Hill, SC
pros: Culture, people, teamwork, care for the employees, focus on student success.
cons: Communication can be lacking sometimes from the higher ups.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Rock Hill, SC
pros: Top leadership and administration seems to be incredibly supportive of employees and their well-being. They implemented some initiatives like a hybrid work from home schedule and early release Fridays in the summer. Middle management is where I had issues with as they are the ones who appear to be less supportive of personal lives of their employees.
cons: I started during Covid so unfortunately my onboarding and training was almost non-existent. When we did come back to campus, I wasn’t given any opportunity to network and had to meet people on my own. There was a lot of turnover during my two years and it led to low morale as everyone was overworked and underpaid. I constantly was bringing work home and would also see many of my colleagues online late at night! My mental health tanked the longer I was there and my overall well-being has significantly improved since I left.

job_title: Adjucnt Instructor in Rock Hill, SC
pros: The flexibility of working when you want per semester

review_title: York Tech is dedicated to student success

cons: Senior leadership is dedicated to student success, but employee welfare/health not a major consideration IMO. Lots of talk about support, but not action.
